moves.1. f4: In this game, I play black and open with a combination of moves that my Dad calls a "Bobby Fisher" opening (which is also called "Reti" when it is played for white, and can be the Old Indian in some variants).  It makes for a closed game.  I'm still experimenting with this opening for black and learning things as I go, and I'd truly enjoy your comments on the strengths and weaknesses of this opening for black.
moves.1... Nf6 2. Nc3 g6 3. e4: As is fairly typical, this closed opening cedes the center pawns to white.
moves.3... d6 4. h3 Bg7 5. Qf3: White doesn't advance the d pawn, which allows me to advance the c pawn.
moves.5... c5 6. Bc4 O-O 7. b3 Nc6 8. Nge2: Completed the fist 8 moves of this opening.  At this point, there are options to attack the middle or either side, particularly the queenside.
moves.8... a6 9. Bb2 b5 10. Bd3:
I was expecting 10. Bd3, and thought I'd move e5, ...
10. Bd3 e5
11. fxe5 Nxe5
moves.10... b4: ... but I changed my mind and moved b4 first, thus pressuring the knight.
moves.11. Nd5 e5: ... then moved to e5.  At this point, I would have expected f5 or fxe5 ...
moves.12... exf4: ... thus allowing me to go back on the offensive setting up what would be the beginning of the end at move 17.
moves.13. Nexf4 Ne5 14. Nxf6+ Bxf6 15. Qg3 Nxd: A good old fashioned Queen fork.
moves.21... a5: The chess gods were smiling on me ... I saw the potential for a stacked Queen and rook along the diagonal ...
moves.22. a4 Ba6: ... and he didn't see it coming.
moves.23. Qd5 Qxd5 24. exd5:
I expected this to happen ...
24. exd5 Bxf1
25. Rxf1 Rf-e8
26. Rf6 Ra-d8
moves.24... Bxf1: The rest of the game was spent making sure I didn't do anything stupid.
moves.25. Rxf1 f5: ... but changed my mind and advanced the f pawn with the support of the rook.
Although I expected this ...
36. Rh2 Re2 
37. Rxe2 fxe2
(King can't block)
... he decided to trade rooks.
moves.36... Rxd2+ 37. Kxd2 Re2+ 38. Kd1 Ke6 39:
Just some closing notes here on out ...
39. b4 cxb4
39. Kc1 f2
39. h5 gxh5

gameName: Fisher/Reti opening for black, Queenside counterattack
